channel.title: Implies Rules :: CIS 301 Textbook
channel.description: In this section, we will see the deduction rules for the implies operator. Note that in our Logika proofs, the implies operator is typed as __>: but is rendered as →. Implies elimination Remember that → is a kind of logical “if-then”. Here, we understand p → q to mean that p holds knowledge sufficient to deduce q – so, whenever p is proved to be a fact, then p → q enables q to be proved a fact, too.
